hero.headline: Nonprofit, play-based childcare in Queen Anne and Capitol Hill, Seattle.
hero.subheadline: NAEYC-accredited early learning for infants through preschool. Reggio-inspired curriculum, organic meals, and an inclusive community where every child belongs.

about.shortIntro: Beginnings Schools is a nonprofit early learning organization with over 30 years of history in Seattle. We operate two NAEYC-accredited centers—one in Queen Anne and one in Capitol Hill—serving children from 3 months to 5 years old.
about.mission: We believe every child deserves a nurturing, play-rich environment where they are seen, valued, and supported in their unique developmental journey.
about.history: Founded in 1992 as a parent cooperative in Queen Anne, Beginnings grew from a small group of families seeking high-quality, community-driven childcare. Today, we maintain that cooperative spirit while serving a broader community across two locations.

philosophy.title: Our Approach
philosophy.intro: Our Reggio Emilia-inspired philosophy views children as capable, curious, and full of potential. Learning happens through exploration, relationships, and meaningful projects—not worksheets or rigid schedules.

pillars.title: Play-Based Learning
pillars.description: Children learn best through hands-on exploration. Our classrooms are designed as inviting studios where curiosity leads the way.

pillars.title: Emergent Curriculum
pillars.description: Teachers observe children's interests and design learning experiences that extend their thinking and build on their questions.

pillars.title: Inclusive Community
pillars.description: We celebrate diversity and practice anti-bias education. Every family is welcomed and every child's identity is affirmed.

pillars.title: Parent Partnership
pillars.description: Families are essential partners in their child's learning. We maintain open communication and offer meaningful ways to participate.

accreditation.naeyc: Both of our centers hold accreditation from the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC), meeting the highest standards for early childhood programs in the nation.
accreditation.nonprofit: As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, every dollar goes back into our programs, our teachers, and our facilities—not to shareholders.

enrollmentProcess.intro: We welcome families of all backgrounds. Our enrollment process is designed to help you learn about us—and for us to learn about your child and family.

steps.title: Submit an Inquiry
steps.description: Fill out our simple online form with your child's information and preferred location. We'll follow up within 1–2 business days.

steps.title: Tour the School
steps.description: Visit your preferred location to see our classrooms, meet teachers, and ask questions. Tours are typically 30–45 minutes.

steps.title: Receive an Offer
steps.description: When a spot opens for your child's age group, we'll extend an enrollment offer and share tuition and paperwork details.

steps.title: Start & Orientation
steps.description: Before your child's first day, we'll schedule an orientation visit and create a personalized transition plan together.

enrollmentProcess.waitlistNote: Infant spots are usually waitlist-based due to high demand and small class sizes. Toddler and preschool openings occur more frequently, especially in late summer and early fall. We encourage families to inquire early, even if you're planning ahead.
enrollmentProcess.tuitionNote: Tuition details are shared during your tour or upon inquiry. As a nonprofit, we work to keep costs reasonable while ensuring our teachers are fairly compensated.

meals.intro: Good nutrition is foundational to learning and wellbeing. We take pride in the food we serve and the positive mealtime experiences we create.

approach.title: Organic & Whole Foods
approach.description: Our menus emphasize organic produce, whole grains, and minimally processed ingredients. We source locally when possible.

approach.title: Inclusive of Dietary Needs
approach.description: We accommodate allergies, intolerances, and family dietary preferences. Please share your child's needs during enrollment.

approach.title: Family-Style Meals
approach.description: Children serve themselves and eat together, building independence, social skills, and healthy relationships with food.

meals.sampleMenu: A typical lunch might include roasted chicken with herbs, quinoa, steamed broccoli, and fresh fruit. Morning and afternoon snacks feature items like hummus with vegetables, whole-grain crackers, and seasonal fruit.

dailyLife.intro: Each day at Beginnings balances structure and flexibility, with plenty of time for play, rest, outdoor exploration, and creative expression.

rhythm.activity: Arrival, breakfast, free play and morning activities
Circle time, project work, outdoor play
Outdoor play, free choice, gradual pickup

communication.title: Staying Connected
communication.description: We use a secure app to share daily updates, photos, and developmental observations. Teachers are available at pickup for quick chats, and we schedule formal conferences twice a year.

team.intro: Our teachers are the heart of Beginnings. We invest in hiring experienced, passionate educators and supporting their ongoing growth.
